t: Proverbs 10
A Collection of Solomon’s Proverbs
Solomon’s*p proverbs: A*pn wise son brings joy to his father, but*ln a foolish son, heartache to his mother.
Ill-gotten*pn gains do not profit anyone, but*ln righteousness rescues from death.
The*pn Lord*s will not let the righteous go hungry, but*ln he denies the wicked what they crave.
Idle*pn hands make one poor, but*ln diligent hands bring riches.
The*pn son who gathers during summer is prudent; the*ln son who sleeps during harvest is disgraceful.
Blessings*pn are on the head of the righteous, but*ln the mouth of the wicked conceals violence.
The*pn remembrance of the righteous is a blessing, but*ln the name of the wicked will rot.
A*pn wise heart accepts commands, but*ln foolish lips will be destroyed.
The*pn one who lives with integrity lives securely, but*ln whoever perverts his ways will be found out.
A*pn sly wink of the eye causes grief, and*ln foolish lips will be destroyed.
The*pn mouth of the righteous is a fountain of life, but*ln the mouth of the wicked conceals violence.
Hatred*pn stirs up conflicts, but*ln love covers all offenses.
Wisdom*pn is found on the lips of the discerning, but*ln a rod is for the back of the one who lacks sense.
The*pn wise store up knowledge, but*ln the mouth of the fool hastens destruction.
The*pn wealth of the rich is his fortified city; the*ln poverty of the poor is their destruction.
The*pn reward of the righteous is life; the*ln wages of the wicked is punishment.
The*pn one who follows instruction is on the path to life, but*ln the one who rejects correction goes astray.
The*pn one who conceals hatred has lying lips, and*ln whoever spreads slander is a fool.
When*pn there are many words, sin is unavoidable, but*ln the one who controls his lips is prudent.
The*pn tongue of the righteous is pure silver; the*ln heart of the wicked is of little value.
The*pn lips of the righteous feed many, but*ln fools die for lack of sense.
The*pn Lord’s*s blessing enriches, and*ln he adds no painful effort to it.
As*pn shameful conduct is pleasure for a fool, so*ln wisdom is for a person of understanding.
What*pn the wicked dreads will come to him, but*ln what the righteous desire will be given to them.
When*pn the whirlwind passes, the*ln wicked are no more, but*ln the righteous are secure forever.
Like*pn vinegar to the teeth and smoke to the eyes, so*ln the slacker is to the one who sends him on an errand.
The*pn fear of the Lord*s prolongs life, but*ln the years of the wicked are cut short.
The*pn hope of the righteous is joy, but*ln the expectation of the wicked will perish.
The*pn way of the Lord*s is a stronghold for the honorable, but*ln destruction awaits evildoers.
The*pn righteous will never be shaken, but*ln the wicked will not remain on the earth.
The*pn mouth of the righteous produces wisdom, but*ln a perverse tongue will be cut out.
The*pn lips of the righteous know what is appropriate, but*ln the mouth of the wicked, only what is perverse.
